Although I already had DirectX 11, I checked the box to install DirectX 9.0c and I expected it to say i have a newer version, but it actually installed something. I know its supposed to be backwards compatible, but I say you should install it anyway.

Worked for me. I am using XP 32bit. I mounted the iso with DAEMON Tools lite. After installing the exe file I closed it all down, restarted my computer, copied and pasted the SKIDROW contents into the correct program files on my computer. I've played it for a few hours and had no problems at all. 

As for the game I didn't know it wasn't going to be like all the other Lara Croft, this one is not at all like those games. It plays a bit like the old school Golden Axe game. It's still pretty fun with lots of hidden treasures and challenges. Fun game overall. Thanks SKIDROW
